short_description.162: They follow in the footsteps of REI workers in New York City who formed a union earlier this year.
short_description.353: Delaware Chancery Judge Kathaleen McCormick dealt the world's richest person a setback in ordering a speedy trial on his abandoned deal to buy Twitter.
short_description.632: Starbucks' move follows McDonald's exit from the Russian market last week.
short_description.690: Cryptocurrency trading platform Coinbase has lost half its value in the past week.
short_description.727: At 3.6%, unemployment nearly reached the lowest level in half a century.
short_description.837: Recent statements by CEO Howard Schultz offer a glimpse of some of the hardball tactics that might lay ahead.
short_description.849: “My offer is my best and final offer and if it is not accepted, I would need to reconsider my position as a shareholder,” Musk said in a filing.
short_description.919: More than 100 Alaska Airlines flights were canceled by the airline, including 66 in Seattle, 20 in Portland, Oregon, 10 in Los Angeles and seven in San Francisco.
short_description.967: That makes seven Starbucks stores that have voted to unionize in a matter of months.
short_description.1046: That makes six union Starbucks stores with more than a hundred others seeking elections.
short_description.1054: The decision comes as surging oil prices have been rattling global markets and after Ukraine’s foreign minister criticized Shell for continuing to buy Russian oil.
short_description.1078: Unemployment fell to 3.8% as the economy continues its pandemic recovery.
short_description.1117: The store in Arizona joins two in New York as the only corporate Starbucks stores with a union.
short_description.1121: Asian and European stock markets plunged and oil prices surged to nearly $100 a barrel Thursday after Russia attacked Ukraine.
short_description.1289: Stocks notched modest gains after climbing back from a steep slide that had knocked more than 1,200 points off the Dow Jones Industrial Average.
short_description.1430: After omicron hit, some consumers stayed home and shifted their spending to e-commerce -- but sales stayed strong.
short_description.1468: Cyberattacks have interrupted schools, hospitals, government and an array of businesses across the country.
short_description.1595: Retailers are expected to usher in the unofficial start to the holiday shopping season Friday with bigger crowds than last year in a closer step toward normalcy.
short_description.1797: Workers at Piedmont Airlines say their wages are too low to live on. Now they might join other striking workers.
short_description.1798: The federal entity created to guard against another Great Recession just issued its first landmark report on global warming.
short_description.2837: The problem was exposed after two men were killed in a Tesla that authorities said was driverless but CEO Elon Musk denied.
short_description.3286: The video game retailer shot up nearly 70%, clawing back much of its steep loss from the day before.
short_description.3379: The workers will soon determine whether the retail giant has its first unionized facility in the U.S.
short_description.3387: So far three former officials with Armstrong Coal have acknowledged their part in a fraud made public by HuffPost.
short_description.3481: “I am dreaming one day I can go back to school," said a 10-year-old Indonesian girl who works at a palm oil plantation that helps produce the cookies and other Western brand items.
short_description.3857: Murray fought federal mine safety regulations for years.
short_description.4025: Android creator Andy Rubin, accused of sexual harassment, was given a severance package worth $240 million, according to the lawsuit.
short_description.4090: Nearly all the improvement in the unemployment rate over the past few months has been for white workers.
short_description.4259: Partners at Red Associates described Black women as “angry” and “scary,” and one person was asked to use eugenicist-approved “The Bell Curve” in research.
short_description.4319: About 67 Smithfield workers a day were contracting the virus at the peak of the outbreak, the CDC found.
short_description.4331: The controversial oil route once again fended off an order to shut down -- for now.
short_description.4364: As a member of the Geek Squad, harassment was constant, a former Best Buy employee says in a new lawsuit.
short_description.4387: A recent memo at one grocery chain said to provide masks at the door, but if the customer refuses to wear it, "let them shop."
short_description.4427: The brand claims it decided to repackage products labeled "Trader Ming's," "Trader Giotto's," "Arabian Joe," and more "several years ago," not because of the petition.
short_description.4471: Does this mean we all get free hamburgers?
short_description.4774: Many of them were devoted longtime members of the iconic weight-loss program. They’re heartbroken.
short_description.4943: The athletic apparel brand said the offensive shirt wasn't its product and the executive who promoted it on Instagram is "no longer an employee."
short_description.4983: Photos of members of the farmer-owned cooperative will replace the logo used since 1928.
short_description.5011: Despite extra federal funding, many of Tennessee’s power providers are still cutting off service to families who can’t pay during the coronavirus pandemic.
short_description.5101: Several other luxury hotels stepped up later to offer beds to medical workers in the midst of the pandemic, Gov. Andrew Cuomo said.
short_description.5124: Employees at the company's California call center have been told to continue working despite a statewide shelter-in-place order.
short_description.5174: Companies are voluntarily halting disconnects over unpaid bills, but advocates warn there’s no legal obligation to do so amid the COVID-19 outbreak.
short_description.5664: The company is revamping its guest standards and banning open-invite parties across the app after a shooting at a San Francisco rental left five people dead.
short_description.7191: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission filed a motion asking for the Tesla CEO to show why he shouldn't be held in contempt.
short_description.7221: The subpoenas are related to litigation involving alleged asbestos contamination in Johnson & Johnson's Baby Powder product line.
short_description.7249: Expect liquidation sales as the stores wind down operations by spring.
short_description.7274: A New Jersey bill, sparked by the Toys R Us and Sears layoffs, would require large companies to pay off workers they're dumping.
short_description.7326: When cuts were first announced last year President Trump called them "disappointing."
short_description.7362: A 13-count indictment was unsealed in New York.
short_description.7525: Despite a dismal year, the market closed out 2018 on a bright note.
